trends: There have been 5 other sightings in Liberty
There were no other sightings in Liberty on or around February 26th 2010
Summary: bluish light w/tail moving from stop position
divs: Sighting DetailsAt approximately 21:03 hrs. local, I was trying to pull into my driveway, but was blocked by an Indiana State Trooper helping a motorist. When said Trooper got out of his car and walked up to me, I explained I lived in the house he was blocking. He politely moved his car and as I was pulling in, notice through a large break in the clouds, a saturn or star like object in a stationary position. The object was a bluish and white color, very luminescent with a small tail of the same color. It then did a quick backup and shot forward, gaining momentum and wobbling. It also did a small zig zag, then came to another stop. This would not be inherent of a satellite as then it faded. I thought perhaps the clouds may have obscured the object, however, there were visible stars and planets near it. I then exited the vehicle to go into the house and felt it inappropriate to speak with the Trooper because he was busy. There was also another Trooper present, but I also felt it inappropriate to bother him, too. My background is in Earth and Space Science, hence, I am familiar with astronomical objects. This did not behave as a satellite, star, planet or ISS. Since living in Indiana, I have seen some pretty interesting stuff, but it was a little more exciting living on Long Island, where I had seen quite a bit of interesting things since the 1950's. My only reaction was that I thought it was pretty cool. My feelings after the sighting? Only that it is inconceivable that we humans are alone in the universe, so I just smiled to myself.
